user.name: Steve Miller
user.description: 🦅 Advanced Practices 🦅 @FireEye Writing/sharing research for my 2011 self and all students of #infosec, intermittent contributor to #dailyyara/#dailypcap

retweeted_status.full_text:
I get all hyped up when I hear #APT3, they're one of my favs.

Most #APT3 tools (esp UPS/Pirpi) are highly configurable by params at the CLI.

You can find/use UPS/Pirpi implants/controllers for a C2 network, or to remotely help your dad remove duplicates from his iTunes library. https://t.co/a70QE6QB2y

user.name: Steve Miller
user.description: 🦅 Advanced Practices 🦅 @FireEye Writing/sharing research for my 2011 self and all students of #infosec, intermittent contributor to #dailyyara/#dailypcap

quoted_status.full_text: @malcomvetter Yep! “UPS” and “Pirpi” are the original/main backdoor ecosystem used by APT3, thus stemming a common namesake for the “group” (though I’d never dare!) UPS breaks out into a few flavors and derivatives so it gets complicated as you delineate deeper, UPS/Pirpi is easiest.
